discussion.content:
Selected Answer: B
B. Setting a BIOS password
A BIOS password prevents unauthorized users from accessing and modifying BIOS settings, including changing the boot order to load an alternative operating system from a USB drive or external media.

A. Installing a host-based firewall protects the system from network threats but does not prevent alternative OS booting.
C. Patching the operating system enhances security but does not restrict boot options.
D. Removing unnecessary software helps reduce vulnerabilities but does not prevent booting from external sources.

questions.question_text: An IT manager wants to prevent end users from booting alternative operating systems on workstations. Which of the following security-related best practices would be used to accomplish this?

choices.A: Verify there is full system functionality.

questions.question_text: A technician has received multiple reports about a media player, which is located in a waiting room, turning on and off at various times of the day. The technician replaces the power adapter and turns the player back on. Which of the following should the technician do next?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: A
A. Verify there is full system functionality.
After replacing the power adapter and turning the media player back on, the technician should confirm that the issue is resolved and that the device is functioning correctly. This is part of the troubleshooting process, ensuring that the fix was successful before considering the job complete.

B. Document the findings/lessons learned comes after verifying functionality.
C. Implement the solution was already done when the power adapter was replaced.
D. Research the knowledge base would be useful if the issue was still unresolved.

Selected Answer: B
B. Redundant power
Fault tolerance refers to the ability of a system to continue operating despite hardware or software failures. Redundant power, such as an uninterruptible power supply (UPS) or backup generators, ensures that a system remains operational even if the primary power source fails.

A. Data restoration and D. Restoring access are related to recovery after a failure, not fault tolerance.
C. Disaster recovery is a broader concept that includes planning for major failures but does not specifically ensure continuous operation like fault tolerance does.

questions.question_text: Which of the following business continuity concepts is the best example of fault tolerance?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: C
C. Portability
Flat files are simple text-based files that store data in a plain format, usually separated by delimiters like commas or tabs (e.g., CSV files). One of their main advantages is portability, as they can be easily transferred between different systems without requiring specialized database software.

A. Variety of data – Flat files store structured data but do not support complex relationships like relational databases.
B. Scalability – Flat files are not efficient for large datasets or complex queries, making them less scalable.
D. Multiple concurrent users – Flat files lack concurrency control, making them unsuitable for multiple users editing data simultaneously.

questions.question_text: Which of the following is an advantage of a flat file?

A. LAN access is required.
Since the application is hosted on a local network (LAN), users need access to the LAN to use the application.

B. The application exists locally. – This would imply the application is installed on a local device rather than hosted on the network.
C. Files are saved in the cloud. – This is incorrect because the application is hosted on a local network, not in the cloud.
D. Internet access is required. – Not necessarily; a local network does not require internet access unless it connects to external resources.

choices.C: Files are saved in the cloud.
